alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:01PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PLUMAS AND EAST CENTRAL LASSEN COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM PDT... At 559 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Antelope Lake, or 15 miles west of Herlong, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph with brief heavy rainfall. Some localized flooding and minor runoff issues will be possible within the Dixie Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Antelope Lake, Lone Rock Campground, Boulder Creek Campground, and Long Point Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
